elements.title: Construction Innovation Hub
elements.description: The Construction Innovation Hub brings together expertise from [BRE](https://www.bregroup.com/), the [Manufacturing Technology Centre (MTC)](http://www.the-mtc.org/) and the [Centre for Digital Built Britain (CDBB)](https://www.cdbb.cam.ac.uk/) to transform the UK construction industry.

elements.title: Better Buildings Partnership
elements.description: Better Buildings Partnership is a collaboration of the uk's leading commercial property owners who are working together to improve the sustainability of existing commercial building stock.

elements.title: Innovation Gateway
elements.description: The Innovation Gateway is an alliance of organisations working in partnership to reduce the costs and environmental impacts of their buildings; through innovations in energy, waste, water, productivity and wellbeing.

elements.title: Flexible Power
elements.description: Western Power Distribution, SP Energy Networks, Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks and Northern Powergrid have announced they are collaborating on 'Flexible Power' to signpost and operate all of their flexibility requirements. [In the news, Oct 2020](https://theenergyst.com/four-dnos-collaborate-to-streamline-flexibility-across-networks/)

elements.title: Green button data
elements.description: The [Green Button initiative](https://www.greenbuttonalliance.org/about) is an industry-led effort to respond to a White House call-to-action to provide electricity customers with easy access to their energy usage data in a consumer-friendly and computer-friendly format.

elements.title: CRREM
elements.description: Carbon Risk Real Estate Monitor (CRREM)  faces the challenge to estimate risk and uncertainty associated with real estate decarbonization, building a methodological body and empirically quantify the different scenarios and their impact on the investor portfolios. GRESB is in the consortium

elements.title: SENSEI
elements.description: SENSEI combines pay-for-performance (P4P) arrangements with the Energy Performance Contracting (EPC) model and engages in negotiation games with preliminary stakeholders.

elements.title: Triple-A
elements.description: identifying “Triple-A” energy efficiency investments, aiming to reduce the respective time and effort required at the crucial phase of the investments conceptualization, as well as to increase transparency and efficiency of respective decision making.

elements.title: European Energy Flexibility Platform and Interface (EF-PI)
elements.description: European Energy Flexibility Platform and Interface (EF-PI)  - [link docs](http://fpai-ci.sensorlab.tno.nl/builds/fpai-documentation/development/html/) not really a standard, more a consortium of private companies trying to adopt a common toolset.

elements.title: ICAIEC
elements.description: the International Centre for AI and Climate Change will advise governments on best practice regulation and facilitate the application of AI technology to energy and climate challenges.

elements.title: Smart Buildings Alliance
elements.description: A unifying approach for the Smart Building in the Smart City: the aim of the SBA association (Smart Buildings Alliance for Smart Cities) is to organise the promotion of the Smart Buildings sector within Smart Cities bringing together a group of industry players.
